com.yantra.api.omp.order

Interface getItemListForOrdering

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface getItemListForOrdering

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document getItemListForOrdering(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The getItemListForOrdering API retrieves a list of items based on input criteria.

    • Method Detail

      • getItemListForOrdering

        org.w3c.dom.Document getItemListForOrdering(YFSEnvironment env,
                                            org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                     throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                            java.rmi.RemoteException

        The getItemListForOrdering API retrieves a list of items based on input criteria. This list of items includes additional information such as pricing, availability, and promotions. This API does not return items whose statuses are not published or cannot be sold separately.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: This API invokes the following user exits:

        • com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetExternalPricesForItemListUE - Invoked if the ComputedPrice element is present in the template.
        • com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetPromotionsForItemListUE - Invoked if the Promotions element is present in the template.
        • com.yantra.ycm.japi.ue.YCMGetItemListUE - Invoked unconditionally if implemented.
        • com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetExternalAvailabilityUE - Invoked when inventory data is requested from the promising engine.
        • com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.OMPGetInventoryFromCacheUE - Invoked when inventory data is requested from the promising engine.

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions:
        A list of items matching the input criteria are returned, along with additional data based on the template supplied.

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Additional Information:

        This API supports complex query and order by operations. Note: Order by operation is based on database sorting by using the order by clause. Therefore, computed or inheritable fields may not work properly if provided in the order by criteria. This API also supports all pagination strategies through the getPage API. See getPage API for more information.

        General Availability

        If an item has a DefaultProductClass specified, this value is used as a product class when looking for inventory. Availability will not be returned for items with an ItemGroupCode other than PROD or items with KitCode set to LK.

        Real-time Availability

        Availability is returned if the Availability element is present in the template and GetAvailabilityFromCache is not passed or set to N. If FulfillmentType is present in the input, it will be used when determining availability. Otherwise, if the CallingOrganizationCode's primary enterprise specifies a default distribution rule, that rule will be used. A list of ship nodes can also be passed in to the API to limit the availability search to a specific set of nodes. Finally, if neither FulfillmentType nor ShipNodes is specified in the input and there is no default distribution rule, getItemListForOrdering will fall back on the default sourcing configuration for the calling organization's primary enterprise. When determining availability, getItemListForOrdering looks for product inventory that is available to ship within the next day, ignoring any calendar restrictions. When looking for availability, getItemListForOrdering will request 999999999 quantity of the item. Inventory node capacity will be ignored when determining real time availability. Any quantity that is available from that request is returned as CurrrentAvailableQty. This is the only attribute that will be populated in the Availability output element. Should a node or item have infinite supply, 999999999 will be returned.

        Availability From Cache

        If GetAvailabilityFromCache flag is set to Y, availability information will be obtained from YFS_INVENTORY_ALERTS table if integration with IV is not enabled. The distribution group specified in the input will be used to retrieve the cached availability. If it is not specified in the input, then the calling organizatin's default distribution group will be used. The availability information was previously computed and populated by the Real-Time Availability Monitor (RTAM). In order for the availability information to be computed correctly, the ATP monitor rule must be configured to use network level ATP monitoring. The ShipToAddress in the input XML will not be used to determine the inventory availability from the cache. All attributes under the Availability output XML element are template controlled with the exception of CurrentAvailableQty.

        Integration with Inventory Visibility enabled:

        If GetAvailabilityFromCache flag is set to Y, availability information for the distribution group will be obtained by invoking the network availability api of IV. AvailabilityInformation in the output won't be supported with IV integration.

        Pricing Information

        Pricing information will be returned if the ComputedPrice element is present in the template. If the YFSGetExternalPricesForItemListUE user exit is implemented, the pricing returned will be based on the output of the user exit. If the user exit is not implemented, internal pricing will be used based on the input parameters. The ComputedPrice element can also be used to retrieve pricing for associated items.

        The ComputedPrice element can also be used to retrieve pricing for associated Service items.

        If YFSGetExternalPricesForItemListUE user exit is implemented then ComputedPrice element can't be template controlled.

        Promotions

        If the YFSGetPromotionsForItemListUE user exit is implemented and the Promotions element it present in the template, the user exit will be invoked and its output will be appended to the output of the getItemListForOrdering API. This data is not persisted, and data is not returned if the user exit is not implemented.

        Associated Items

        Associated items, such as "Cross Sell" or "Supersession", can be returned by the getItemListForOrdering API. The ExecuteQueries flag in the input allows for items associated through queries to be returned as well.

        Entitlement Rules

        Items are returned based on entitlement rules, which get applied as follows:

        • Customer Entitlements: Customer entitlment rules get applied when IsForOrdering flag is set to true and Item Entitlement Strategy rule is set to apply entitlment rules. ItemID must also be provided in the input to apply customer entitlement logic. The rules are applied based on the customer information provided in CustomerInformation element. CustomerID is used to get detailed customer information and other customer attributes provided in the input are used as overrides to get entitlement rules. For more information on how customer attributes are used to apply entitlements, please refer to the javadocs for getAssignedEntitlementList API.
        • Selling Entitlements: Selling entitlement rules get applied when the calling organization is not a catalog organization. These rules are applied regardless of the values of Item Entitlement Strategy rule and IsForOrdering flag. Selling Entitlement should only be defined when all regular items, provided services, and deliver services on an order belongs to a category, otherwise these item will fail entitlement validation.
        If multiple entitlement rules apply to a customer or an organization, then a union of items entitled by all rules is returned.

        Item Comparison

        The API will return an aggregated view of item attributes and the values of each item for the item attributes for item comparison, if the output template contains /ItemList/ItemGroupTypeList element. ShowAttributesWithDifferentValuesOnly can be passed in to filter out attributes with same value for all items.

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains exception data. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
